intro: Ipomopsis gunnisonii, commonly known as Gunnison's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the morning glory family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its stems are hairy and branching. Ipomopsis gunnisonii plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
